# Web Dependencies

The web terminal requires xterm.js and addons. To set up:

## Option 1: Use CDN (Recommended for development)

Replace the script tags in `admin/index.html` with:

```html
<link rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/xterm@5.3.0/css/xterm.css" />
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/xterm@5.3.0/lib/xterm.js"></script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/xterm-addon-fit@0.8.0/lib/xterm-addon-fit.js"></script>
<script src="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/xterm-addon-web-links@0.9.0/lib/xterm-addon-web-links.js"></script>
```

## Option 2: Install locally (Recommended for production)

```bash
cd web
npm init -y
npm install xterm xterm-addon-fit xterm-addon-web-links
```

This will install:
- `xterm` - Terminal emulator
- `xterm-addon-fit` - Fit terminal to container
- `xterm-addon-web-links` - Clickable links

## Directory Structure

```
web/
├── node_modules/
│   ├── xterm/
│   │   ├── css/xterm.css
│   │   └── lib/xterm.js
│   ├── xterm-addon-fit/
│   │   └── lib/xterm-addon-fit.js
│   └── xterm-addon-web-links/
│       └── lib/xterm-addon-web-links.js
├── admin/
│   ├── index.html
│   └── index.js
└── index.html
```

## Usage

After installing dependencies, the web terminal will be available at:
- `/admin` - Web-based terminal
- `/` - Home page with links

## Embedded Files

When building, these files are embedded into the binary using `go:embed web/*`.
If `./web` directory exists at runtime, it will be used instead of embedded files.
This allows for easy development and customization.
